remarks: If two structures have the same (nonempty) base set, and the values of their group (addition) operations are equal for all pairs of elements of the base set, one is a magma iff the other one is.  (Contributed by AV, 25-Feb-2020.)
statement:
mgmpropd.k $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
mgmpropd.l $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
mgmpropd.b $e |- ( ph -> B =/= (/) ) $.
mgmpropd.p $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
mgmpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. Mgm <-> L e. Mgm ) ) $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
